hints.content: Let's look whether each multiple of $6$ is odd or even.

Multiple | Is even?
-: | :-:
$6$ | yes
$12$ | yes
$18$ | yes
$24$ | yes
$30$ | yes
$36$ | yes
$42$ | yes
$48$ | yes
$54$ | yes
$60$ | yes
$66$ | yes
$72$ | yes
$78$ | yes
$84$ | yes
$90$ | yes
$96$ | yes

For all the multiples in the table, the statement is true.

Does this work for any number?

Any whole number times $2$ is even.

$\begin{align}
n \times 6 &=n \times (3 \times 2) \\\\
&=n \times 3 \times 2 \\\\
&=(n \times 3) \times 2
\end{align}$

Yes, the statement is **always** true.
When we multiply by $6$, we *always* get an even number.
